text: A superphylum is an unofficial grade in taxonomy, above the phylum and below the subregnum, used to describe a group of phyla which probably evolved from a common ancestor.Introduction to Conservation Genetics, p. 371; Richard Frankham, David A. Briscoe, Jonathan D. Ballou, Cambridge University Press, 2002 It is used especially in the animal kingdom. Examples: *Ecdysozoa *Lophotrochozoa *Radiata *Deuterostomia *Bilateria * Planctomycetes- Verrucomicrobia-Chlamydiae (PVC) == Notes == Category:Taxonomy
title: Superphylum
